paper_abstract: Chemical graphs (simple, connected graphs with maximum degree no greater than three) with eigenvalues +/-root 8 exist for all orders greater than nine, disproving a conjecture of J.R. Dias that no chemical graph with this pair of eigenvalues exists. In fact, the eigenvalue pair can be achieved with arbitrarily high multiplicity.
paper_title: Counterexamples to a conjecture of Dias on eigenvalues of chemical graphs
